Privacy Policy

Crypto Forum Group LLC ("we," "our," or "us") respects and protects the privacy of our event participants, website visitors, sponsors, speakers, and community members. This Privacy Policy describes how we collect, use, and protect your information when you interact with our websites (including CT Digital Forum and Digital FutureFest), events, and communications.

1. Information We Collect

Information You Provide: When you register for an event, sign up for updates, apply to speak, sponsor, or otherwise communicate with us, we may collect your name, company, job title, email address, phone number, mailing address, and areas of interest.

Automatically Collected Information: We may collect information about your use of our websites, such as IP address, device type, browser type, pages visited, and event attendance preferences through cookies and similar technologies.

Third-Party Sources: We may receive information about you from public sources, professional networks, sponsors, or partners, in accordance with their privacy policies.

2. How We Use Your Information

  • To register and communicate with you regarding events like CT Digital Forum and Digital FutureFest.
  • To send updates, newsletters, event announcements, and related communications.
  • To manage event participation, speaking engagements, sponsorships, and partner activities.
  • To provide a better website experience by analyzing usage and optimizing our services.
  • To fulfill our legal, contractual, and regulatory obligations.

We may aggregate and anonymize your data for research, analytics, and reporting purposes.

3. Sharing of Information

  • Sponsors and Partners: To enhance your event experience, with appropriate privacy protections in place.
  • Service Providers: Who assist with our operations, event management, marketing, analytics, and technical services.
  • Legal Compliance: When required by law, regulation, legal process, or government request.
  • Business Transfers: In the event of a merger, acquisition, reorganization, or sale of assets.

We do not sell your personal information.

4. Cookies and Tracking

Our websites may use cookies and similar technologies to enhance user experience, analyze site usage, and provide tailored content. You can adjust your browser settings to refuse some or all cookies; however, some site features may not function properly without cookies.

5. Your Choices

You have the right to:

  • Access and Update: Request access to or correction of your personal information.
  • Opt-Out: Unsubscribe from our marketing communications at any time by following the link at the bottom of our emails or contacting us directly.
  • Data Deletion: Request deletion of your personal information, subject to applicable legal exceptions.

To exercise any of these rights, please contact us at privacy@ctdigitalforum.com.

6. Data Security

We implement reasonable technical and organizational measures to protect your personal information against unauthorized access, use, disclosure, or loss. However, no method of transmission over the internet or method of electronic storage is completely secure.

7. Third-Party Links

Our websites may contain links to third-party websites. We are not responsible for the privacy practices or content of those external sites. We encourage you to review their privacy policies independently.

8. International Visitors

Our events are primarily U.S.-based (Connecticut, NY Tri-State), but we welcome participants globally. By providing your information, you acknowledge that your information may be transferred to and processed in the United States.

9. Changes to This Privacy Policy

We may update this Privacy Policy periodically to reflect changes in our practices or applicable laws. We will post any changes on this page with a revised “Effective Date.” We encourage you to review this policy regularly.

10. Contact Us

If you have any questions about this Privacy Policy or our practices, please contact:

Crypto Forum Group LLC
Email: membership@ctdigitalforum.com
Phone: 646-807-9040

Terms of Use

Welcome to the websites operated by Crypto Forum Group LLC ("Crypto Forum Group," "we," "our," or "us"). These Terms of Use govern your access to and use of our websites, including CT Digital Forum and Digital FutureFest (collectively, the "Sites") and participation in our events ("Events").

By accessing our Sites or attending our Events, you agree to be bound by these Terms of Use and our Privacy Policy. If you do not agree, you must not use our Sites or attend our Events.

1. Use of Sites and Content

The content on our Sites, including event information, speaker lists, schedules, articles, logos, images, and videos ("Content"), is owned by Crypto Forum Group LLC or its licensors and is protected by intellectual property laws.

You may:

  • View, download, and print limited portions of the Content for your personal, non-commercial use.

You may not:

  • Copy, reproduce, distribute, republish, display, perform, or create derivative works of the Content without our prior written consent.
  • Use the Sites or Content for any unlawful or unauthorized purpose.
  • Attempt to access or tamper with non-public areas of the Sites, servers, or systems.

2. Event Attendance

Participation in CT Digital Forum and Digital FutureFest is subject to registration approval and event-specific terms. We reserve the right to:

  • Refuse or cancel registration at our discretion.
  • Change speakers, topics, schedules, or venue details.
  • Enforce event policies including attendee behavior standards, badge usage, and security rules.

By attending our Events, you acknowledge that photographs, videos, or audio recordings may be taken that include your image, voice, or likeness, and you consent to our use of such materials for promotional, educational, and other legitimate purposes without further notice or compensation.

3. User Conduct

  • Engage in any behavior that disrupts, harms, or interferes with other participants, the Sites, or Events.
  • Submit false, misleading, or unauthorized information.
  • Upload or distribute any harmful code (e.g., viruses, malware) through the Sites.
  • Violate any applicable law, regulation, or third-party rights.

We may remove content, deny access, or take other actions if you violate these Terms.

4. Links to Third Parties

Our Sites may contain links to third-party websites or resources. We are not responsible for their availability, content, or privacy practices. Use of third-party websites is at your own risk.

5. Disclaimer of Warranties

The Sites, Content, and Events are provided "as is" and "as available" without warranties of any kind, express or implied. We do not guarantee that the Sites or Events will be uninterrupted, error-free, secure, or free of viruses or other harmful components.

6. Limitation of Liability

To the fullest extent permitted by law, Crypto Forum Group LLC and its officers, directors, employees, and affiliates will not be liable for any direct, indirect, incidental, consequential, special, or punitive damages arising out of or relating to your use of (or inability to use) the Sites, Content, or participation in Events.

7. Indemnification

You agree to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Crypto Forum Group LLC and its affiliates, officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any claims, damages, losses, liabilities, and expenses arising out of or related to your use of the Sites, Content, or participation in Events, or your violation of these Terms.

8. Changes to These Terms

We may modify these Terms of Use at any time. Changes will be effective immediately upon posting to the Sites. Your continued use of the Sites or participation in Events after changes are posted constitutes your acceptance of the updated Terms.

9. Governing Law

These Terms are governed by and construed under the laws of the State of Connecticut, without regard to conflict of law principles. Any disputes arising from these Terms or your use of the Sites shall be resolved in the state or federal courts located in Connecticut.

10. Contact Us

If you have any questions about these Terms of Use, please contact:

Crypto Forum Group LLC
Email: membership@ctdigitalforum.com
Phone: 646-807-9040
